command: iptables -I INPUT -m recent --name t1205_icmp --rcheck --seconds 60 -p tcp --dport 31337 -j ACCEPT; iptables -I INPUT -p icmp --icmp-type echo-request -m string --string "PINGOPEN" --algo bm -m recent --name t1205_icmp --set -j LOG --log-prefix "T1205-ICMP-SIGNAL "; nc -l -p 31337 -k >/dev/null 2>&1 &
explanation: Matches ICMP echo-request payloads containing the ASCII token PINGOPEN. On detection, logs and enables TCP/31337 for 60s, guarded by the signaling source, where nc listens. Shows non-TCP/UDP packet signaling with payload inspection.
rationale_steps: Inspect ICMP payload for a specific token
Log anomalous ICMP requests for alerting
Conditionally expose a listener based on the ICMP signal
